body_html:
Hi @InsZVA i I am having the same issue but on Ubuntu 16.04 and I am running it in a docker container. I did all of the following:

  • switched to branch r1.3 (because I am running TF v1.3.0)
  • Added the two additional lines you mentioned to serving/tensorflow/tensorflow/BUILD
  • built libtensorflow.so (using the instructions from here: https://malmaud.github.io/TensorFlow.jl/latest/build_from_source.html)
  • And then I copied libtensorflow.so to my usr/bin directory in attempt to follow the directions from the link above. This supposedly installs the TF binary.
  • I also tried setting an environment variable called LIBTENSORFLOW to the original path of libtensorflow.so

I am still having the same error. Is there something that I've done wrong?

body:
Hi @InsZVA i I am having the same issue but on Ubuntu 16.04 and I am running it in a docker container. I did all of the following: 

- switched to branch r1.3 (because I am running TF v1.3.0)
- Added the two additional lines you mentioned to serving/tensorflow/tensorflow/BUILD
- built libtensorflow.so (using the instructions from here:    https://malmaud.github.io/TensorFlow.jl/latest/build_from_source.html)
- And then I copied libtensorflow.so to my usr/bin directory in attempt to follow the directions from the link above. This supposedly installs the TF binary.
- I also tried setting an environment variable called LIBTENSORFLOW to the original path of libtensorflow.so

I am still having the same error. Is there something that I've done wrong?
